channel.title: Are there any objects/patches that allow you to type in a Hz/Note value?
channel.description: Hi all, Is there an object that allows you to type in hz/note values instead of fractionals/ints? I'm also looking for an object that displays the tempo/bpm of an object to 3 decimal places? I found sputnki's 24ppq to bpm object, unfortunately it's displaying the bpm as an integer.

item.title: Are there any objects/patches that allow you to type in a Hz/Note value?
item.dc:creator: @Reggie
item.description:
@Reggie wrote:

Thanks guys, I had a feeling that was the case. I'll wait or write one that does

Read full topic

@jaffasplaffa wrote:

Yeah, I understand. The object cannot be set like that as is now. As far as I know. Toneburst thinks the same. Maybe later on

item.source: Are there any objects/patches that allow you to type in a Hz/Note value?

item.title: Are there any objects/patches that allow you to type in a Hz/Note value?
item.dc:creator: @Reggie
item.description:
@Reggie wrote:

@grimmreefer unfortunately that's only displaying the hz/note value, what I'd like to be able to do for example is type in 50hz or E4 into the dial control and have the dial automatically set itself to the closest fractional value that matches, notes should be relatively simple as they appear to be integer values on the fractional dial.

Read full topic
item.source: Are there any objects/patches that allow you to type in a Hz/Note value?

item.title: Are there any objects/patches that allow you to type in a Hz/Note value?
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

Reggie:

Hi all, Is there an object that allows you to type in hz/note values instead of fractionals/ints?

I dont think it is perfect match for what you need, but check dr.justices object called: drj/ctrl/dial_pitch

Read full topic
